The Ferguson Township Police Department has released descriptions of two suspects in an armed robbery that occurred yesterday at the PNC Bank  N PERIOD Atherton St PERIOD

Police said two males one armed with a handgun entered the bank at  a.m PERIOD The suspect with the weapon allegedly demanded money from the teller while the second suspect acted as a lookout at the door of the bank PERIOD Both fled on foot toward the Giant Food Store  Northland Center PERIOD There were no injuries during the robbery police said PERIOD

Shortly after the robbery at  a.m. Ferguson Township police and Penn State University Police surrounded a Centre Area Transportation Authority CATA bus near the HUB Parking Deck PERIOD Police removed a passenger and allowed the bus to leave after about  minutes said Sherry Snyder a CATA supervisor PERIOD

The lead investigator in the case Detective John Conti said two men with descriptions similar to the suspects were detained after the robbery until witnesses from the bank could rule them out PERIOD Conti was unable to confirm if the passenger removed from the bus was one of the men detained by police PERIOD

Conti said police are using surveillance footage from bank cameras along with multiple witness accounts in the investigation PERIOD

Police said the suspects are two black males in their mid20s PERIOD Both were dressed in a white shirt black tie black coat and hat PERIOD The suspect that carried the gun is about  feet to  feet  inches tall and spoke with a Jamaican accent while the second suspect is  feet  inches to  feet tall PERIOD Both suspects were described as having 

Conti said the amount of money stolen has been determined but he refused to say how much it was PERIOD

Only one uniformed officer was on patrol in Ferguson Township during the robbery and it took seven to eight minutes for the officer to respond to the call Conti said PERIOD

Linda Vizi an FBI spokeswoman said the bureau is assisting the Ferguson Township police in their investigation PERIOD The FBI has jurisdiction over robberies involving banks insured by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. of which PNC Bank is a member Vizi said PERIOD

Police officers from Patton Township State College Penn State and the Centre County Sheriffs Office assisted in the search for the suspects PERIOD

Conti said the case is a high priority for his department PERIOD

The bank remained closed yesterday and will reopen today said Rob Rutz a spokesman for PNC Bank PERIOD
